Without adorning the five-character sentences, the vow is made to encourage and exhort.

The body is neither a person nor a life, not a hero or a scholar,
If the essence or if not radiant, these matters are all non-existent.
The body is created and exists, but with existence comes decay and death,
Without strength, all return to life, like foam trampled to pieces;
Without strength is impermanence, impermanence is suffering,
Impermanence is also suffering, the body is not the self;
The body is impermanent and suffering, it should not be the body.
If the essence, radiance, and self exist, the body has nothing that can exist;
If there is no essence at all, existence also has coming and going.
The wise one, with beginning and end, how can there be a self that already exists?
If it is said to be without a master, it cannot be obtained by oneself,
If there is such a calculation, how can there be a self that has a body?
This body is empty, and the self that has a body is false,
It should be due to causes and conditions, not created by the departing mind of the body,
Not created by the bodies of many people, nor created by one's own body,
There is no creation of the body, nor is the body without creation.
Since the body has no creator, it is obtained from that which is true.
Coming from the past world, the body is also not created by the gods,
Not a city transformed by the spirit, not without practice or basis,
Without causes, it has a self, and this body has a basis,
There are events, and there are also things.
Gradually giving rise to existence, originally due to delusion and craving,
The mind and the defiled with craving, are also bonds and fetters.
The two categories of actions are the outflows.
The world and the causes of suffering, because of them, this body,
Gradually able to reach existence.

The Buddha has cut off the lineage for the day, all of those sections are gathered together,
The sense faculties are used as stitches, not wounds but wrapped in them,
The flesh and blood are applied as plaster, like a wooden mechanism with strings,
It is like a magician's illusion.
Bound together with sinews, forming a collection of bones like this,
It is considered to be this physical body.
Fools are not free from attachment, while the wise are free from attachment.
The nine orifices are like great wounds, leaking all around,
A place of impure decay and foul stench, with the mouth as an orifice,
Filled with various grains, this body is like that.
Nourishing the various internal organs, hair, body hair, nails and teeth,
Dust and dirt, skin, bones and joints, and bone marrow,
Common tendons and blood vessels, stomach and heart, and spleen,
Large intestine and small intestine, liver and lungs, and kidneys,ğŸ”½Fat and feces, tears and saliva, and sweat,
Nose mucus, grease, and blood, cold and hot, and urine,
The brain and meninges, all sink into it,
Like an old cow smeared with mud, as it is formed, it does not know.
The inside and outside of the body, the city of bones and walls,
The flesh and blood are used as adornments, and they are destroyed by enemies.
Always internally and externally, with many hundreds of them,
They are greedy for its flesh, and externally there are also disasters.
They all have many faults, and this body is rotten and decaying.
It is like an old city, serving it day and night,
Decaying and then decaying again, like a pit and an empty village;
Always with thieves staying together, taking it to deceive and endanger people,
The body is a den of poisonous snakes, and the poisonous snakes are extremely poisonous;
Always dwelling in the body, with the poison of joy and anger, deceit and wickedness,
And the poison of not being harmonious and magnanimous.
Always with harmony and peace, if angry then there is no reciprocation,
And in an instant it is not peaceful again.
Disliking and having fear, like a tiger roaming in a desolate marsh,
Having fear and much terror.
All thoughts are for the sake of the body, which is a vessel for all suffering, and also for all hardships.
This body is the master of experience, sinking in the Dharma of suffering,
A dwelling for all illnesses, the Dharma of old age and death.
The body increases affection, suffering from cold and heat,
Or wind that is not harmonious, then illness arises.
For the decay of the faculties, lost to the harm of disease and thieves,
Old age and death oppress people, like a snow-covered fire,
Quickly explained.
The many calamities of the body, all that I have expounded,
Have not yet been fully completed.
The decaying body is unreal, formed from many causes and conditions,
With a great self as the body.
The Buddha Speaks the Chapter on the Verses of Contemplating the Internal Body Eleven Causes and Conditions The Buddha said:
There are eleven causes and conditions for practitioners to extinguish the path and restrain people from falling into evil paths. Those who do not recognize them are called myriad things.
First, a great assembly, referring to a multitude of people;
Second, eating too much, referring to various delicacies, also referring to overeating;
Third, engaging in too many activities, referring to too much work;
Fourth, too much noise, referring to too much talking;
Fifth, too much sleep;
Sixth, gathering, referring to meditation;
Seventh, practicing too much, referring to too many affairs;
Eighth, being attached to the body;
Ninth, being frivolous, referring to improper speech;
Tenth, greed, referring to excessive desires;
Eleventh, not dwelling in a good place, referring to among bad people.
Practitioners should cut off these eleven causes and conditions to quickly attain the path.
